marketNews.title: Wall Street Journal reports US considering cutting China tariffs
marketNews.content: Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday (23/4) that the United States government is considering cutting import tariffs on China in an effort to de-escalate trade tensions. An anonymous official in the White House told the Wall Street Journal that the tariff for China could fall from the current 145% to a range of 50-65%. Reuters reported that the plan is still awaiting talks with China, as the decision to lower tariffs will not be made unilaterally.

marketNews.title: China's Ministry of Commerce denies any US-China tariff talks
marketNews.content: China's Ministry of Commerce said on Thursday (24/4) that there are no tariff negotiations with the United States, and that claims of progress in the talks are not based on facts. Spokesperson He Yadong said the United States must remove all unilateral tariffs on China if it truly wants to resolve the issue.

marketNews.title: OPEC+ may accelerate oil output in June 2025
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that several OPEC+ members will propose to accelerate oil output in June 2025, driven by disputes among members over quota compliance. If implemented, the move would mark a second consecutive month of output increase. Oil prices had fallen to a four-year low in April 2025, pressured by the US-China trade war and an unexpected OPEC+ decision to raise production by 411,000 barrels per day from May 2025 – three times the original plan. Eight OPEC+ members will meet on 5 May 2025 to discuss the June 2025 production plan.

marketNews.title: Indonesia 2025 GDP growth seen around 5% YoY, says finance minister
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani said on Thursday (24/4) that Indonesia's 2025 economic growth is likely to stay around +5% YoY despite global trade tensions (versus a 2024 realization of +5.03% YoY). Her comment came two days after the IMF cut its 2025-2026 growth forecast from +5.1% to +4.7% YoY. The government targets a 5.2% YoY growth for 2025 and President Prabowo Subianto has pledged to raise growth to +8% YoY by 2029.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Q1 2025 foreign direct investment up 15.9% YoY
marketNews.content: Indonesia's Investment and Refinement Ministry reported that Q1 2025 investment realization reached 465.2 trillion rupiah (+15.9% YoY, +2.7% QoQ), representing 24.4% of the 2025 target of 1,905.6 trillion rupiah, and created 594,104 jobs. Foreign direct investment contributed 230.4 trillion rupiah (+12.7% YoY), marking the weakest annual growth in the last five quarters.

marketNews.title: Chinese coal importers bypass HBA, prefer Indonesian Coal Index
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that Indonesian coal importers in China are not using the Indonesian Coal Benchmark (HBA) in transactions because the price reference is not transparent, is updated slowly, and is more expensive. The Indonesian Coal Association said exporters also avoid HBA because Chinese importers are more familiar with the Indonesian Coal Index. Previously, although the HBA has been in force since 1 March 2025, the government gave a relaxation allowing exporters to continue using the Indonesian Coal Index for existing contracts.

marketNews.title: RUPTL 2025-2034 does not include early coal-plant retirements
marketNews.content: The Director General of the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Jisman Hutajulu, said on Wednesday (23/4) that the 2025-2034 Electricity Supply Plan (RUPTL) does not discuss early retirement of coal-fired power plants. Member of DPR Commission XII, Ramson Siagian, said the decision to retire new coal plants will be reviewed after the contract with PLN ends, to ensure future electricity supply. The Ministry had previously issued Ministerial Regulation No. 10/2025 allowing accelerated de-commissioning of coal plants.

marketNews.title: SMIL CEO Hadi Suhermin purchases 21.2 million shares
marketNews.content: Sarana Mitra Luas (SMIL) CEO Hadi Suhermin bought approximately 21.2 million SMIL shares at 492 rupiah per share on 23 April 2025. The transaction value was about 10.4 billion rupiah, raising his direct ownership from 50.08% to 50.32%.

marketNews.title: Strategy: “Sell in May and Go Away” in the IHSG
marketNews.content: The “Sell in May and Go Away” note reminds investors that selling all stocks when the market looks risky can cause missed gains; the key is strategy and readiness, not panic. – Illusix

tickerNews.title: UNVR 1Q25 net profit beats expectations
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia (UNVR) recorded net profit of 1.24 trillion rupiah in 1Q25, a 15% decline YoY but a 245% increase QoQ, beating the consensus (equivalent to 32% of the 2025F consensus estimate). Cost-efficiency programmes are beginning to show results, but revenue trends remain weak. Gross margin recovered to 48.2% (vs 49.9% in 1Q24 and 44.5% in 4Q24) after a dip to about 45% in the prior two quarters. Operating margin rose to 17.1% in 1Q25 (vs 18.7% in 1Q24 and 6.7% in 4Q24) from a prior 7-9% range. Operating-margin improvement was driven by a 45% YoY (-69% QoQ) decline in salary costs after the one-off employee-reduction cost disappeared. Advertising expense stayed stable at 9.2% of revenue (vs 9% in 1Q24, 5.8% in 4Q24, 8.8% in 2024).

tickerNews.title: HMSP 1Q25 volume flat, market share falls to 26.8%
tickerNews.content: HMSP (Philip Morris International) reported that Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna’s cigarette volume reached 20.4 billion sticks in 1Q25 (+0.6% YoY, +0.5% QoQ), below the industry-wide growth of 75.9 billion sticks (+2.6% YoY, +1.9% YoY in 4Q24). HMSP’s market share fell to 26.8% in 1Q25, the lowest since 1Q14; it had been stable around 27.3-27.4% in 1Q24-4Q24. Product-segment sales were flat at 20.1 billion sticks (+0.4% YoY) while IQOS volume grew 0.3 billion sticks (+15.7% YoY).

tickerNews.title: BBTN 1Q25 net profit and loan growth
tickerNews.content: Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) posted a net profit of 904 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+5.1% YoY, –2.3% QoQ), equal to 29% of the 2025F consensus. Net interest income rose to 3.8 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY, +34% QoQ) and net interest margin increased to 3.6% (vs 3.3% in 1Q24, 2.9% in 2024). Provisions rose 49% YoY and 47% QoQ, with credit cost (CoC) up to 1.1% (vs 0.8% in 1Q24, 0.6% in 4Q24) but still within the 2025 guidance. Loan growth was +5.5% YoY in 1Q25 (vs +15% YoY in 1Q24, 7.3% in 2024), below the 2025 guidance of 7-8% YoY. The bank’s Sharia-finance unit spin-off is targeted to start operations in October 2025.

tickerNews.title: BSDE 1Q25 marketing sales
tickerNews.content: Bumi Serpong Damai (BSDE) recorded marketing sales of 2.43 trillion rupiah in 1Q25 (+9% YoY, –16% QoQ), equal to 24.3% of the 2025 target of 10 trillion rupiah. The biggest contribution came from the residential segment (52.5%), followed by retail (ruko) 31%, apartments 6%, commercial 5.5% and land-to-joint-venture sales 5%.

tickerNews.title: BTPN to pay 2024 dividend
tickerNews.content: Bank SMBC Indonesia (BTPN) will distribute a 2024 dividend of approximately 562.6 billion rupiah or about 52.8 rupiah per share, a 20% dividend payout ratio and an implied 2.5% dividend yield as of Thursday (24/4). The cum-date is 30 April 2025 on the regular market, with payment on 23 May 2025.

tickerNews.title: HEAL 2025 revenue and EBITDA targets
tickerNews.content: Medical-care group Medikaloka Hermina (HEAL) said its 2025 revenue target is 7.8 trillion rupiah (+16% YoY versus 2024) and EBITDA target is 2.2 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY versus 2024). The company plans to build two new hospitals in Bali and Salatiga and to increase bed capacity from 8,252 to 9,000 beds.

tickerNews.title: MIKA targets double-digit 2025 growth
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) reported that it targets double-digit revenue and net-profit growth in 2025. To achieve this, MIKA plans a capital expenditure of about 800 billion-1 trillion rupiah in 2025 (versus 1 trillion in 2024) and will build two new hospitals with a total capacity of roughly 90-110 beds.

tickerNews.title: TOWR 2024 dividend approval
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara (TOWR) shareholders approved a 2024 dividend of 800 billion rupiah (24% payout) implying a final dividend of 9.9 rupiah per share; the payment date has not been announced. Previously, TOWR paid an interim dividend of 300.2 billion rupiah (6 rupiah per share) in January 2025.

tickerNews.title: TPIA acquires Barito Investa Prima
tickerNews.content: Chandra Asri Pacific (TPIA) bought the entire shareholdings of PT Barito Investa Prima from affiliates Barito Pacific (BRPT) and PT Griya Idola for a total consideration of 90 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: UNVR 1Q25 detailed financials
tickerNews.content: UNVR 1Q25 net profit of 1.24 trillion rupiah (+15% YoY decline, +245% QoQ) exceeded consensus, with margin recovery in both gross and operating margins. Gross margin recovered to 48.2% (vs 49.9% in 1Q24, 44.5% in 4Q24) and operating margin improved to 17.1% (vs 18.7% in 1Q24, 6.7% in 4Q24). Salary-cost reduction – -45% YoY, -69% QoQ – removed one-off cost. Advertising expense stayed at 9.2% of revenue, up from 0.9? Home-and-personal-care (HPC) margin = 50.2% (vs 53.3% in 1Q 24, 44.9% in 4Q24). Foods-and-refreshment (F&R) revenue declined only -1% YoY. The commentary notes the worst-ever-so-far-by-the-…
